Adding a Group

As an administrator, it is your responsibility to organize the users who can log on to a server configuration into groups. Creating and using groups simplifies the task of managing security on a project. Each group can be assigned a set of privileges that apply to all the users in that group, instead of setting privileges on a user-by-user basis.

After you create a group, you must specify the access rights the group will have to the server and projects. If the group is added to another group that already has the desired rights, no further action is necessary.

Note: Groups can be added only to servers that are currently running.

To add a group:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

      • These actions display the User Manager dialog.

  4. Select the All Users group to serve as the parent of the new group.

  5. To set properties and privileges for the new group, do one of the following:

    • Click the New Group button

    • Right-click the All Users group and select New from the context menu.

      • The New Group Properties dialog opens.

  6. On the General tab, enter the group name in the Name text box, and a synopsis of the group in the Description text box.

  7. Select the Privileges tab. Privileges selected on this tab override any access rights previously set for any user in the group. They apply to all items in all projects on the specific server configuration. However, they should not be used as a substitute for access rights.

  8. Select or clear the appropriate check boxes to grant or deny privileges to the group. For details, see the StarTeam Administrator's Guide.The privileges include:

    • See object and its properties.

    • Modify object properties.

    • Delete object.

    • Purge object.

    • Acquire object ownership.

    • Change object security settings.

    • Create object and place it in a container.

    • Grant all specific class-level rights for all classes of objects.

  9. Click OK. The new group appears in the Groups list.
